docs.lead_paragraph: In August 1994, the city turned itself upside down looking for a 2-month-old girl who was snatched from her mother at her job in Brooklyn.

headline.main: Abducted as an Infant, Revisiting It as an Adult
headline.print_headline: Abducted as an Infant, Revisiting It as an Adult

docs.abstract: Grace Notes column; profile of Helen Anea Salcedo, Queens woman who was abducted as a 2-month-old in 1994 from her mother's workplace in East New York, Brooklyn; Salcedo recalls being about 10 years old when her mother first told her about events that shocked city.
docs.snippet: In August 1994, the city turned itself upside down looking for a 2-month-old girl who was snatched from her mother at her job in Brooklyn.

docs.lead_paragraph: A growing number of rural hospitals are closing their doors, forcing many Americans in small communities to travel much farther for medical care.

headline.main: Rural Hospitals Struggle to Stay Open, Adapt to Changes
headline.print_headline: Rural Hospitals Struggle to Stay Open, Adapt to Changes

docs.snippet: A growing number of rural hospitals are closing their doors, forcing many Americans in small communities to travel much farther for medical care.
